page.title: 02Local History - St Combs (1)
page.content: {St Combs}is the youngest of the three fisher touns having been founded in the year{1771}to replace{Corsekelly}a mile to the south.Yet in a sense it is the oldest centre too, for the remote ancestors of many a{Cairnbulg and {Inverallochy fishermen}lie in the kirk yard of{St.Combs}around the ruins of its ancient pre_Reformation church. It lies in the{Parish of Lonmay}yet today{St.Combs village}now yet by far the largest centre of population in the Parish has{no church.St.Combs}is a fishing village that is{south east}of {Fraserburgh and north of the Loch of {Strathbeg.}Long ago the{Loch of {Strathbeg}was part of the{North Sea, it was a natural harbour where ships could anchor in safety.One night a terrific storm blew up and the entrance to the harbour was blocked with sand.
